title: REPAIR SMALL TEARS USING CABLE TIES

content.note: If cable ties are not available, use twine, cord, string, or lightweight rope
text: • Remove debris and ragged material from damaged area of screen.
content.note2: Position cable ties 1 in apart and 1 in (~ 2 cm) away from edge of tear.
text2: • Starting at one end of tear, push cable tie through net material.
• Position cable tie perpendicular to tear. Push through net material on other side of tear.
• Close cable tie and tighten. Ensure material is tightly secured to prevent loose material or gaps.
• Repeat Steps 2-4 until tear is sealed. Cut off excess cable ties.

title: REPAIR LARGE TEARS USING REPAIR MATERIAL

text: • Remove debris and ragged material from damaged area of screen.
• Select a piece of screen material from the screen repair kit of the correct type and class.
content.note2: Repair material should be slightly larger than repair area.
text2: • Cut repair material to appropriate size.
• Position repair material over damaged screen. Attach using the Repair Using Cable Ties procedure.

text: • A missing or broken becket loop may be bypassed by looping through next available becket loop.
• When more than one becket loop in a row is missing or broken, replace them using available tie material.
• If three or more of the same kind of loops (short, long) in a row are damaged or missing, replace screen.
Preventive Maintenance Checks and Service (PMCS) are performed to keep ULCANS in operating condition.
The checks are used to find, correct, or report problems.
PMCS is done every day ULCANS is deployed using the PMCS tables found in the Technical Manual (TM) or by referring to the guidelines below.
content.note2: Perform procedures in accordance with the ULCANS Technical Manual.

text: Items:
• Inventory contents of modular screen system carrying case and support system carrying case.
• Ensure ULCANS is packed in proper deployment configuration.
• Inspect support pole tubes for damage.
• Ensure foot of support pole is secure and undamaged.
• Ensure grounding loop of support pole is secure, rotates freely, and is undamaged.
• Ensure locking mechanisms are functional.
• Ensure shape disruptors are moveable and undamaged.
• Inspect screen module for fabric damage or for evidence of many previous repairs.
• Inspect screen module for damage becket loops and grounding loops.
• Inspect identification tags to ensure they are present and readable.
• Ensure that net assembly is properly assembled.
• Ensure all becket loops are properly connected and secured with a knot.
Items:
• Ensure that tent pins, tie down points, and becket loops remain secure.
• Clear any accumulated rain, snow, damp, leaves, or other environmental hazards as applicable.
• Confirm camouflage pattern matches other screens in net assembly.
• Confirm there are no gaps of 6 in (~ 15 cm) or more in seams of joined screens.
Items:
• Inspect screens for debris, sticks, grass, leaves, etc. Remove debris as required
• Inspect support system components for damage and debris. Repair or replace components as required.
